org.pojava.util
Class EncryptionTool

java.lang.Object
  org.pojava.util.EncryptionTool

public class EncryptionTool
extends java.lang.Object

This utility provides a simple interface for encrypting and decrypting data using high-quality encryption algorithms such as AES-128 and AES-256. You will need to install the Java(TM) Cryptography Extension for encryption stronger than 128-bit. It also provides a means of importing and exporting both the algorithm and cipher key as a String. Example usage: String doc="This is the content to be encrypted"; byte[] raw=doc.getBytes(); String keyString=EncryptionTool.generateAES256WithCBCKeyString(); // (This keyString could be retrieved from JNDI, for example) byte[] encrypted=EncryptionTool.encrypt(raw, keyString); ... byte[] decrypted=EncryptionTool.decrypt(encrypted, keyString); String originalDoc=new String(decrypted);

Author:
John Pile
